item.title: Travis add a quote by Jostein Gaarder
item.description: "Wasnâ€™t it extraordinary to be in the world right now, wandering around in a wonderful adventure!" -- Jostein Gaarder

item.title: Travis add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Travis add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Travis add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Stories make us more alive, more human, more courageous, more loving." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Travis add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Travis add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Truth is what is true, and it's not necessarily factual. Truth and fact are not the same thing. Truth does not contradict or deny facts, but it goes through and beyond facts. This is something that it is very difficult for some people to understand. Truth can be dangerous." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Travis add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Travis add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "We do not know what things look like. We know what things are like. It must be a very limiting thing,this seeing. -Aunt Beast" -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Travis add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Travis add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Travis add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "At Tara in this fateful hour, I place all Heaven with its power, And the sun with its brightness, And the snow with its whiteness, And the fire with all the strength it hath, And the lightning with its rapid wrath, And the winds with their swiftness along their path, And the sea with its deepness, And the rocks with their steepness, And the earth with its starkness: All these I place, By God's almighty help and grace Between myself and the powers of darkness!" -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Travis add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Travis add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "It might be a good idea if, like the White Queen, we practiced believing six impossible things every morning before breakfast, for we are called on to believe what to many people is impossible. Instead of rejoicing in this glorious "impossible" which gives meaning and dignity to our lives, we try to domesticate God, to make his might actions comprehensible to our finite minds." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Travis add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "After the Israelites safely crossed the Red Sea, the Egyptians chased after them and were drowned. God's angels wanted to celebrate the enemy's demise. God saw this and grew angry. He said, in essence, 'Stop celebrating. For they are my children,too." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Travis add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant filled with odd little waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like." -- Lemony Snicket
